Based on your preferences, I would recommend watching the movie "Titanic" (1997). This movie tells the story of a wealthy aristocrat and a poor artist who fall in love aboard the luxurious, ill-fated R. M. S. Titanic. The movie has won numerous awards including Academy Awards for Best Picture and Best Director for James Cameron.

Additionally, you might also want to watch the movie "Michael Clayton" (2007). This movie tells the story of a law firm that brings in its  "fixer" to remedy the situation after a lawyer has a breakdown while representing a chemical company that he knows is guilty in a multibillion-dollar class action suit. The movie has won numerous awards including Academy Awards for Best Picture and Best Director for George Clooney.

Finally, you might also want to watch the movie "District 9" (2009). This movie tells the story of an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum- like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology. The movie has won numerous awards including Academy Awards for Best Picture and Best Director for James Cameron.

Overall, these movies are all highly rated by audiences around the world.
